newsitem.title: CANADA: Suncor oil sands plant to shut down Sunday.
newsitem.headline: Suncor oil sands plant to shut down Sunday.

text.p: Suncor Energy Inc said on Wednesday that a much-anticipated 30-day maintenace shutdown of its oil sands plant would start on Sunday.
Suncor said the outage for various maintenace functions, aimed at improving the plant's reliability, production capability and environmental performance, would cost C$36 million.
Synthetic oil output from the oil sands operation, Canada's second-largest, was expected to rise to 85,000 barrels per day from the current level of about 79,900 after the work.
An additional 2,500 workers were scheduled to be on site during the shutdown, Suncor said.
